H0.text: Long hair is a trait that children can inherit from their parents.

H1.text: Favorite color is a trait that children can inherit from their parents.

H2.text: Brown eyes is a trait that children can inherit from their parents.

H3.text: A broken arm is a trait that children can inherit from their parents.

A4.text: Mendel's work provided examples where traits were definitely not blended after hybridization, showing that traits are produced by combinations of distinct genes rather than a continuous blend.

A5.text: This theory (commonly associated with Jean-Baptiste Lamarck) is now known to be wrongâ€”the experiences of individuals do not affect the genes they pass to their children.
